C

Card - Class in Unnamed Package
Card.java represents a single character game Card.
Card(String, String, int, int) - Constructor for class Card
The constructor initializes the instance fields with the values provided in the parameters.
checkResistance(String, String) - Method in class GameMaster
The checkResistance() method enables the GameMaster to determine if a Card type is resistant to another Card type.
checkWeakness(String, String) - Method in class GameMaster
The checkWeakness() method enables the GameMaster to determine if a Card type has a weakness to another Card type.
claimToken() - Method in class Player
The claimToken() method enables the Player to increment (add 1) to the number of prizes accumulated.

D

dealCard() - Method in class GameMaster
The dealCard() method enables the GameMaster to fill each Player's hand with Cards at the start of the game.
dealDamage(Card, Card) - Method in class GameMaster
The dealDamage() method enables the GameMaster to compute and apply the damage value that the target-card should sustain.
discard() - Method in class Player
The discard() method enables the Player to remove the Card that has been eliminated from his/her hand.
drawCard(Card) - Method in class Player
The drawCard() method enables the Player to add a Card to his/her hand, as long as there is space in the array.

G

GameConsole - Class in Unnamed Package
GameConsole.java provides the user with a console interface through a main method and reads input from a Scanner object.
GameConsole() - Constructor for class GameConsole
 
GameMaster - Class in Unnamed Package
GameMaster.java is responsible for conducting the game, keeping track of whose turn it is, making sure that game-play rules are followed, and declaring the end of the game when one of the players wins.
GameMaster(Player, Player) - Constructor for class GameMaster
The constructor initializes the instance fields.
GameMaster(Player, Player, boolean, boolean) - Constructor for class GameMaster
Depending on whether the student chooses to implement optional features, more constructors may be defined to accommodate the options.
gameReport() - Method in class GameMaster
The gameReport() method the GameMaster to display a summary of the game.
getActiveCard() - Method in class Player
The getActiveCard() method enables the Player to return the Card object in the first (active) position.
getHealth() - Method in class Card
The getHealth() method enables the Card to return the current value of its health.
getName() - Method in class Card
The getName() method enables the Card to return its name.
getName() - Method in class Player
The getName() method enables the Player to return his/her name.
getPower() - Method in class Card
The getPower() method enables the Card to return the value of its attack power.
getTokens() - Method in class Player
The getTokens() method enables the Player to indicate how many tokens he/she has accumulated.
getType() - Method in class Card
The getType() method enables the Card to return its type.

H

handIsFull() - Method in class Player
The handIsFull() method enables the Player to indicate whether or not his/her hand is full.
hasWinner() - Method in class GameMaster
The hasWinner() method enables the GameMaster to indicate whether or not a Player has won the game.

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class GameConsole
 

P

play(String) - Method in class GameMaster
The play() method enables the GameMaster to handle each Player's turn in game play.
Player - Class in Unnamed Package
Player.java is participates in a game through a GameMaster.
Player(String) - Constructor for class Player
The constructor initializes the instance fields.

S

statusReport() - Method in class Player
The statusReport() method enables the Player to display the status of the Cards in his/her hand.
swap() - Method in class Player
The swap() method enables the Player to swap two cards.

T

takeDamage(int) - Method in class Card
The takeDamage() method enables the Card to update the value of its health.
